reviewText:
I'll admit that rally games are my guilty pleasure.  Most feature mushy controls, daft physics or ridiculously undamageable cars.  this has none of those.  The controls are crisp, the physics moderately good, and cars which will fly apart satisfyingly when you ram into a building or errant rock.   The career feature is quite well done, leaving you to decide which cars to buy to win certain races.  It does have relatively few maps (4 maybe?), but  a lot of variety of tracks round them keep things moderately interesting.  Stability-wise, there were very few glitches (I can count them on one hand, after months of play). The car addons actually feel like they're making a difference, and strategic part and tyre-selection can make an impossible stage remarkably enjoyable.

The games's only main downside is the repetitiveness.  Only four 'areas', means you get to race the same track over and over in different directions and different combinations of bits.  The openness of the career path does also lead to you making bad choices when purchasing cars and add-ons from time to time.   That means you must  race the same race 10x in a row to get the money to afford the thing you should have bought instead.    The only other small downside is the micro-stutter which occurs when a texture or sound is first loaded.  That can cause you to spin out, or miss a corner (e.g. when the game first loads the copilot voice for that corner).  A quick reload, and it doesn't happen there again.   Other than these small niggles, the game is notably bug and hassle-free.

I recommend anyone who likes Rally games to play this.. It's got satisfaction value in spades, and while it's not as polished as Colin Macrae, I think in some areas it beats it (blasphemy!!) :-)

reviewText: We can't buy Richard Burns Rally anymore, but we can buy this instead. It's not exactly a simulation (even on simulation" mode)
date: but it is a ton of fun. The physics are based in reality
recommended: and you can use all of the standard techniques to induce oversteer. It's a bit easy to go sideways
voteText: but not glaringly unrealistic. I am not a rally driver
helpfulPercent: but I checked the FWD performance against Live For Speed (an acknowledged "realistic" sim) on its rallycross tracks
votesHelpful: and I was able to get a similar FWD car (the Mini clone) to oversteer using throttle liftoff and brake
votesTotal: just like I was doing in Xpand. One funny thing is that you seem to be able to do powerslides in FWD cars in Xpand
votesFunny: which is obviously unrealistic. But that's fine
commentsCount: I just imagine that the FWD cars are AWD. The bottom line is that the physics are authentic enough that you can use the instincts you have developed in sims and have fun doing it.\n\nApart from physics and realism
column16: the game is just a lot of fun to play. I have played the first stage about a dozen times
column17: just because it's really fun. If you do nothing but play that first race
column18: it will be more than worth the price. The stage design is one of the best things about this game: the stages are all completely crazy
column19: with lots of tight turns and elevation changes keeping you on your toes without being unrealistic. And unlike many newer games
column20: you don't have to sit through cutscenes
column22: and boring intro missions to get to the gameplay. Thankfully
column23: you just turn it on and go right to the good part (the sideways racing).\n\nIt is an old game
column24: so you will have to edit a configuration file if you want full 1080p resolution and 144Hz refresh rate
column25: but it's easy. The file you're looking for is called VideoSettings.scr
column26: and it's located in the Xpand Rally\Data folder. The settings in the file are clearly labeled and self-explanatory. Have fun!\n\nEdit: This game has a crazy difficulty curve. Don't try to drive insanely "at the limit
column27: because some very strange things can happen with the physics at the limit. Instead, upgrade your car and drive carefully according to the pacenotes. Still a fun game and worth $5.

reviewText:

Non-licensed cars are a bit lame, but you do have some tuning and upgrade options which is nice.

reviewText:
Bought this game a month or two ago and ive played a good ammount of it. Its pure awesome. One of the best rally games ive played in a long time. It is very old but its cheap and for its price, its an excellent game. Totally worth 5 bucks!

Very realistic physics engines and car damage. For example. You try to turn 45Degrees on dry tarmac going 100km and it works vs trying the same thing on dust would not. Also the car damage aspect is near perfect. For example you crash into a tree and your car gets a large dent where it hit the tree.

9/10 Good game!

reviewText:
A fantastic rally game!  It is pretty realistic I would say, although the handbrake doesn't work like I think it should and the game is lacking the function to add a clutch button for controller use but that doesnt ruin it at all. Plus I don't know the exact release date but I remember it being fairly old, so you have to take that in to consideration.

The Rally Championship mode is excellent, with semi-realistic damage that may need to be replaced after every event. Individual parts can become damaged.

There is are no real manufactures in here which is a let down, but the cars are all modeled after real ones and have funny knockoff names. (IE. Tiny Hooper - Mini Cooper)

$5 for a realistic rally game. It was bought for me but knowing how good it is now I probably would of paid $10 for it.

reviewText:
***Please read thouroughly***

Well now, I've played many racing and rally games in my time, and this just so happens to be one. The general theme and ideas set forth by the creators of this game were actually well thought, but the full point conversion could not be made due to, what i'd beleive to be, a lack of funding or technology, or simply the want to make a fully functional game.

The first time i played this game, (enough times to make the average gamer turn in disgust) I appriciated the areas in which the game would of excelled, if not for its very bold failure, In which I mean the physics. Most racing fans love realism or simulation, in fact alot even prefer arcade style driving... but this game is far from either, with the realism of a 1982 version of a grand prix game. I can say in nay of everything wrong, once you get used to it, it becomes quite enjoyable and the stages themselves are quite challenging, eliminating the boring far off expectation from a 3rd party" game title. So all in all
hoursPlayed: after the hour (or 5) of trying to comprehend how u controll you AWD beast.... And lastly

reviewText:
at default settings the game isn’t very good.
feels like hovercraft racing.
once you start messing with the files, the game becomes good.
i changed the gravity and messed with cars dimensions, weight etc.
and i play it on arcade, the sim option is just too “floaty” for my taste, almost no grip at all.

DO NOT MESS WITH FILES IF YOU INTEND TO USE MULTIPLAYER

The files you need to edit are :
Xpand Rally\Data\logic\SingleRace\Cars.scr
Here you can change the dimensions, weight etc.
And
Xpand Rally\Data\Physics\ODEPhysicsCar.scr
Here change SetExtraGravity(0, -200, 0)  to SetExtraGravity(0, -700, 0)

Start with the gravity thing and work your way from there.
I play a lot of rally games, this isn’t a bad one, just needs a bit of tweaking
To really shine.

reviewText: Game is based on a Need for Speed-like career mode in which you can not progress unless you win on whatever individual stages are next on the list. reviewText:
Best rally game on Steam after Dirt Rally?! Forget about the WRC series, Xpand Rally has much better FFB and feel.

It has adrenaline, the cars can be upgraded and you can tinker with the setup quite deep. The only drawback is the missing licenses but who cares if the driving is so smooth!? And nevertheless all the cars are basically copies the it's real equivalents, so you get Puntos, VW Golfs, Seat Cordobas, Mitsubishis, Fords etc. There are tons of categories which makes the learning curve much more enjoyable.

Interesting feature that this is the only rally game where you can even die in game. Just as the car you can also get serious damage.

For 5 euros you get a decent rally game. But please don't yell because of the outdated graphics and the engine, this game became 10 years old in 2016. Much better game than WRC series.
